availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John T. Norwood (Louisville, Kentucky, farmer and contractor )

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, farmer, brickmaker, and contractor. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth M. Allison Norwood in Shelby County, Kentucky, on February 4, 1836. Father of Andrew B. Norwood. Married to Mary Moody Norwood in Shelby County, Kentucky, on July 25, 1840. Father of Sallie Norwood, Martin Norwood, and Edward Norwood. Farmer in Shelby County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Shelby County in 1850. Brickmaker in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1860. Household owned two enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860. Hired an additional two enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860. Contractor in Louisville in 1862. Contractor in Louisville in 1864. Contractor in Louisville in 1865.
